snippet: While many gardeners regard the partially decomposed plant matter as an elixir, environmentalists say taking peat from centuries-old bogs disturbs vital ecosystems.
abstract: Environmental experts say that increased awareness of impact peat bogs have on carbon emissions is needed, despite fact that British government's plans to eliminate peat from all gardening products has already led to decline in use; plans ignited a raucous debate between environmentalists, gardeners and the gardening industry.
lead_paragraph: While many gardeners regard the partially decomposed plant matter as an elixir, environmentalists say taking peat from centuries-old bogs disturbs vital ecosystems.

headline.seo: British Gardeners Battle Over Peat, for Bogs’ Sake
headline.main: British Soil Is Battlefield Over Peat, for Bogs’ Sake
headline.print_headline: British Soil Is Battlefield Over Peat, for Bogs’ Sake
